result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel G Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $1,189.00 to Randall & Teresa H. and $1,096.80 to West Bend Insurance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervison.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
No alcohol or drugs whatsoever.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided.
Pay all costs and restitution.

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 9/22/14 sentencing.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed by Defense.
filed by the State

Defendant Daniel G Olson in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern and Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 4 1/2 years (Initial Confinement: 18 months - 42 days credit, Extended Supervision: 3 years) 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs totaling $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision; alternate 6 days jail - consecutive. 
- Restitution totaling $1189.oo to Randall & Teresa H. and $1096.80 to West Bend Insurance to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.
- DNA Surcharge totaling $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision; alternate 5 days jaill - consecutive.
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol/drugs whatsoever.  DNA sample if not yet provided. Pay all costs and restitution.
From Department of Corrections requesting an adjournment of the due date for the Presentence Investigation report.  The Court has reviewed and will grant an extension until September 17, 2014.
From T.H.
